snippet: The oil company said on Wednesday that it would spend $39.8 billion on energy projects and other costs this year, down from $42.5 billion last year.
abstract: Exxon Mobil says it will spend $39.8 billion on energy projects and other costs in 2014, down from $42.5 billion in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The oil company said on Wednesday that it would spend $39.8 billion on energy projects and other costs this year, down from $42.5 billion last year.

headline.main: Exxon Mobil to Cut Spending but Raise Production in 2014
headline.print_headline: Exxon Mobil to Cut Spending but Raise Production in 2014
